content.description: Jon Schaffer and Tony McLane Jan 2022. Pitch 1. Follow obvious crack to big ledge on arete. One bolt. 10d 40MPitch 2. Flare to undercling. 11d  30MPitch 3. Finger crack 11d 25MPitch 4. OW 5.10a 25MPitch 5. 2 Bolts out left, then back right for third. 2 more bolts on arete plus small gear. Originally led with no bolts at 5.10d 25MPitch 6. Bolts on arete. 5.11c 25MPitch 7. Bogus bush crawl. Start in chimney behind teetering block. Or head left up arete for an unclimbed and much better finish, looks easy. 5.4 25MDescent Rappel. One 4" bolt per anchor. Bring a drill if you want to. 5 single rope raps plus one double. or 7 single rope raps with a 70m(tight!!)If you see a sightseeing heli flight don't forget to moon them.
content.location: Obvious arete on the corner of the north face.

content.description: The Pagoda (also referred to as the White Bishop) once lended the name Temple Canyon to the drainage currently known as Boynton Canyon (incidentally named after the Boeington family). This iconic butte, recognizable from all angles, is buttressed by elegant golden sandstone walls and capped by a conspicuous nipple of white limestone.
